Uses of Package
com.augursystems.armi

  • Packages that use com.augursystems.armi 
    Package Description
    com.augursystems.armi  
    com.augursystems.armi.demo  
  • Classes in com.augursystems.armi used by com.augursystems.armi 
    Class and Description
    ArmiException
    Wraps any remote exception; analogous to RMI's RemoteException class.
    ArmiInputStream
    This class is used by Packet.decodeInstance(); you don't normally need to use this class directly.
    ArmiOutputStream
    This class is used by Packet.writeExternal(); you don't normally need to use this class directly.
    ArmiVoid 
    Client
    This interface is implemented by ARMI clients that want to receive asynchronous data.
    Filter
    This one-method interface can be implemented to filter asynchronous data packets from being transmitted to the associated Client.
    HostPort
    This encapsulates a host (InetAddress) and port number (int).
    Interruptor
    This class will interrupt the given thread after the given amount of time if the given thread is still alive.
    Packet
    This is the basic wrapper for all messages sent via ARMI.
    Subscription
    This is your receipt for your subscription; hold on to it; you'll need it if you wish to cancel later.
  • Classes in com.augursystems.armi used by com.augursystems.armi.demo 
    Class and Description
    ArmiException
    Wraps any remote exception; analogous to RMI's RemoteException class.
